question: Using the same password more than once is okay if the account doesn't contain sensitive information.
comment: The first step in having security on all accounts is using unique passwords for each one. This is important, even for accounts that don't contain critical information, like credit card numbers.

question: The best way to store your passwords is
answers: saving them in the browser and hitting reset each time you want to log in.
using a password manager like LastPass or 1Password.
comment: While password managers aren't perfect (none can protect you 100% from hacking), they are often the best resource for saving and generating unique passwords for all of your accounts.

question: What is multi-factor authentication?
answers: A method of comparing a user's phone number against the one associated with their account.
Using more than one method to verify the identity of a user.
comment: Multi-factor auth (and more commonly, two-factor) is recommended by most security experts as a way to lessen the chances of an attack. It's best to set up two-factor auth with a separate email or phone number not associated with your phone (Skype or Google Voice number).

question: To protect your phone from SIM hacking
answers: Call your mobile carrier to add a PIN to your card
Use a different phone number for two-factor authentication, like a Google Voice or Skype number.
Never save any passwords in the browser on your phone.
comment: SIM card hacking occurs when a hacker pretending to be you contacts your mobile carrier and convinces them that you've changed phones. Using your phone number, they can log into your account and surpass two-factor authentication using your number on their device. Adding a PIN to your phone's SIM card is a good practice to reduce the chances that it will be hacked. Even better, use a phone number not attached to the SIM card so that hackers can't access it as easily.

question: If a hacker gains access to your SIM card, the first account they are most likely to break into is
comment: Email is usually the first account they will target since it contains the most information about many different sites. They will also target bank accounts, particularly for high profile investors. Social media hacks often are related to the popularity of the account's handle, which may be hacked and sold without the account's owner knowledge.

question: A credit freeze can have the benefit of
answers: increasing your credit score since you won't be opening new lines of credit.
decreasing the chances of credit fraud by temporarily disabling anyone from opening new lines of credit.
decreasing your interest rates on current loans or credit cards.
comment: Credit freezes are a great way to safeguard your credit and prevent fradulent lines of credit from being opened. A freeze won't affect your credit score, but it will require you to lift the freeze in order to rent an apartment, apply for a job, open a new account, etc.

question: The difference between http and https is
comment: HTTPS is more secure than HTTP. Never submit sensitive information through a form where the url begins with HTTP. This could put you at risk for an attack.

question: If you've been hacked, the first thing you should do is
answers: delete all sensitive data from your accounts.
comment: While several of these are good ideas (set up two-factor, delete sensitive data) the first action you should take is changing your passwords.
